directions: Mix: In a large bowl mix mayo, dill, onion, zest, salt and pepper. Add salmon. Mix gently with a soft spatula.

Shape: Pat into 8 cakes, each about 7.5cm across and5cm thick. Roll cakes in breadcrumbs. Set cakes on a baking sheet. Cover with plastic wrap and chill. Chilling is optional, but makes the cakes easier to handle.

Crisp: Heat a thin film of oil in a heavy cast iron pan set over medium heat. Cook salmon cakes in batches until crisp outside and hot inside, about 2 to 3 minutes per side. – Chicago Tribune/McClatchy-Tribune Information Services
ingredients: ¼ cup finely chopped fresh dill
¼ cup finely chopped red onion
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
800g cooked salmon, skin, bones and grey strip of flesh discarded
Mild oil, such as canola, for crisping
title: Salmon Cakes
